We're looking in to how best to handle query parameters. Do you have some examples you can share from your work, so we can make sure we consider your use case?","performed_via_github_app":null},{"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/opticdev/optic/issues/comments/646946708","html_url":"https://github.com/opticdev/optic/issues/204#issuecomment-646946708","issue_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/opticdev/optic/issues/204","id":646946708,"node_id":"MDEyOklzc3VlQ29tbWVudDY0Njk0NjcwOA==","user":{"login":"setshaft","id":7590806,"node_id":"MDQ6VXNlcjc1OTA4MDY=","avatar_url":"https://avatars0.githubusercontent.com/u/7590806?v=4","gravatar_id":"","url":"https://api.github.com/users/setshaft","html_url":"https://github.com/setshaft","followers_url":"https://api.github.com/users/setshaft/followers","following_url":"https://api.github.com/users/setshaft/following{/other_user}","gists_url":"https://api.github.com/users/setshaft/gists{/gist_id}","starred_url":"https://api.github.com/users/setshaft/starred{/owner}{/repo}","subscriptions_url":"https://api.github.com/users/setshaft/subscriptions","organizations_url":"https://api.github.com/users/setshaft/orgs","repos_url":"https://api.github.com/users/setshaft/repos","events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/setshaft/events{/privacy}","received_events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/setshaft/received_events","type":"User","site_admin":false},"created_at":"2020-06-20T05:50:44Z","updated_at":"2020-06-22T02:14:06Z","author_association":"NONE","body":"Hi @LouManglass. Thanks for looking at this issue.
I can think of three different scenarios right away. 

1. http://localhost:3000/api/some-url?key=value&key=different-value
2. http://localhost:3000/api/some-url?key=value
3. http://localhost:3000/api/some-url?key1=value1&key2=value2 

I think the three common scenarios that we see in GET requests are these. Please addon if I missed any commonly used scenario. If the library supports these scenarios, it will be good start with.

Thanks :) ","performed_via_github_app":null},{"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/opticdev/optic/issues/comments/647693886","html_url":"https://github.com/opticdev/optic/issues/204#issuecomment-647693886","issue_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/opticdev/optic/issues/204","id":647693886,"node_id":"MDEyOklzc3VlQ29tbWVudDY0NzY5Mzg4Ng==","user":{"login":"LouManglass","id":241059,"node_id":"MDQ6VXNlcjI0MTA1OQ==","avatar_url":"https://avatars2.githubusercontent.com/u/241059?v=4","gravatar_id":"","url":"https://api.github.com/users/LouManglass","html_url":"https://github.com/LouManglass","followers_url":"https://api.github.com/users/LouManglass/followers","following_url":"https://api.github.com/users/LouManglass/following{/other_user}","gists_url":"https://api.github.com/users/LouManglass/gists{/gist_id}","starred_url":"https://api.github.com/users/LouManglass/starred{/owner}{/repo}","subscriptions_url":"https://api.github.com/users/LouManglass/subscriptions","organizations_url":"https://api.github.com/users/LouManglass/orgs","repos_url":"https://api.github.com/users/LouManglass/repos","events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/LouManglass/events{/privacy}","received_events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/LouManglass/received_events","type":"User","site_admin":false},"created_at":"2020-06-22T18:18:47Z","updated_at":"2020-06-22T18:18:47Z","author_association":"MEMBER","body":"@setshaft This is great, we're definitely looking at scenarios like this. Thanks.

To clarify - if you give several values for a given key (see example 1), would you expect them to be all of the same data type? For example, would you always expect strings, or could one value be interpreted as a string, another an integer, another a boolean...I expect the former, if they're varying data types any additional information on how this endpoint would work would be helpful.

Also, does the key take multiple values, or does one end up "winning" and becoming the captured value?","performed_via_github_app":null},{"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/opticdev/optic/issues/comments/647852183","html_url":"https://github.com/opticdev/optic/issues/204#issuecomment-647852183","issue_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/opticdev/optic/issues/204","id":647852183,"node_id":"MDEyOklzc3VlQ29tbWVudDY0Nzg1MjE4Mw==","user":{"login":"setshaft","id":7590806,"node_id":"MDQ6VXNlcjc1OTA4MDY=","avatar_url":"https://avatars0.githubusercontent.com/u/7590806?v=4","gravatar_id":"","url":"https://api.github.com/users/setshaft","html_url":"https://github.com/setshaft","followers_url":"https://api.github.com/users/setshaft/followers","following_url":"https://api.github.com/users/setshaft/following{/other_user}","gists_url":"https://api.github.com/users/setshaft/gists{/gist_id}","starred_url":"https://api.github.com/users/setshaft/starred{/owner}{/repo}","subscriptions_url":"https://api.github.com/users/setshaft/subscriptions","organizations_url":"https://api.github.com/users/setshaft/orgs","repos_url":"https://api.github.com/users/setshaft/repos","events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/setshaft/events{/privacy}","received_events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/setshaft/received_events","type":"User","site_admin":false},"created_at":"2020-06-23T01:28:21Z","updated_at":"2020-06-23T01:28:21Z","author_association":"NONE","body":"@LouManglass Those were more generic examples which are commonly used in the real world. 
We don't see the 1st example in our work daily. We encounter only the 2nd and 3rd example. 

But for 1st example, we can assume them to be all of the same data type according to the real-world usage I have seen till now. 
While most modern frameworks give them as an array for values when we access that key from the query parameter. So, there are no winning values. While writing the swagger doc we can document key as data_type[]. ","performed_via_github_app":null},{"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/opticdev/optic/issues/comments/648153188","html_url":"https://github.com/opticdev/optic/issues/204#issuecomment-648153188","issue_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/opticdev/optic/issues/204","id":648153188,"node_id":"MDEyOklzc3VlQ29tbWVudDY0ODE1MzE4OA==","user":{"login":"LouManglass","id":241059,"node_id":"MDQ6VXNlcjI0MTA1OQ==","avatar_url":"https://avatars2.githubusercontent.com/u/241059?v=4","gravatar_id":"","url":"https://api.github.com/users/LouManglass","html_url":"https://github.com/LouManglass","followers_url":"https://api.github.com/users/LouManglass/followers","following_url":"https://api.github.com/users/LouManglass/following{/other_user}","gists_url":"https://api.github.com/users/LouManglass/gists{/gist_id}","starred_url":"https://api.github.com/users/LouManglass/starred{/owner}{/repo}","subscriptions_url":"https://api.github.com/users/LouManglass/subscriptions","organizations_url":"https://api.github.com/users/LouManglass/orgs","repos_url":"https://api.github.com/users/LouManglass/repos","events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/LouManglass/events{/privacy}","received_events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/LouManglass/received_events","type":"User","site_admin":false},"created_at":"2020-06-23T13:37:18Z","updated_at":"2020-06-23T13:37:18Z","author_association":"MEMBER","body":"Good to know. I want to be sure that we're covering the examples you're using currently first, since you've taken the time to reach out, and we appreciate the generic examples overall. I agree, they're common, and high on our list as well. I'll let you know what comes of our investigation, and keep you updated with any significant progress.","performed_via_github_app":null},{"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/opticdev/optic/issues/comments/648551581","html_url":"https://github.com/opticdev/optic/issues/204#issuecomment-648551581","issue_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/opticdev/optic/issues/204","id":648551581,"node_id":"MDEyOklzc3VlQ29tbWVudDY0ODU1MTU4MQ==","user":{"login":"setshaft","id":7590806,"node_id":"MDQ6VXNlcjc1OTA4MDY=","avatar_url":"https://avatars0.githubusercontent.com/u/7590806?v=4","gravatar_id":"","url":"https://api.github.com/users/setshaft","html_url":"https://github.com/setshaft","followers_url":"https://api.github.com/users/setshaft/followers","following_url":"https://api.github.com/users/setshaft/following{/other_user}","gists_url":"https://api.github.com/users/setshaft/gists{/gist_id}","starred_url":"https://api.github.com/users/setshaft/starred{/owner}{/repo}","subscriptions_url":"https://api.github.com/users/setshaft/subscriptions","organizations_url":"https://api.github.com/users/setshaft/orgs","repos_url":"https://api.github.com/users/setshaft/repos","events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/setshaft/events{/privacy}","received_events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/setshaft/received_events","type":"User","site_admin":false},"created_at":"2020-06-24T02:56:08Z","updated_at":"2020-06-24T02:56:08Z","author_association":"NONE","body":"@LouManglass Thanks.
